description.name: The Tip Toe Drill helps ensure weight forward to improve consistency in ball contact

steps.name: Using your 7 iron, set up to the ball as normal
Move your trail foot slightly back onto its tiptoe so 95% of your weight is on your lead leg
Hit the ball using a half swing, focusing on balance throughout the shot

details.name: This drill is to be done with a club, ideally an iron or wedge
This drill involves hitting a golf ball, so it is best to use it on the range
This drill mainly attacks issues with ball contact

description.name: The Swing in a Barrel Drill prevents your hip from swaying throughout your swing

steps.name: Using your 7 iron, set up to the ball as normal
During the entire swing, feel as if you are in a 'barrel'
Let your hips and shoulders rotate back and through without 'swaying' out of the barrel

details.name: This drill can be done using any golf club
This drill can be done with a golf ball on the driving range or without a golf ball at home
This drill mainly attacks issues with ball contact

description.name: The Stick the Finish Drill focuses on balance to improve contact and consistency on golf shots

steps.name: Using your 7 iron, take a normal swing
Hold your finish with good balance for 3-5 seconds
All of your weight should be on your front leg at end of swing so that you can easily pickup your trailing foot if needed

details.name: This drill can be done with any golf club
This drill can be done with a golf ball on the driving range or without a golf ball at home
This drill mainly attacks issues with ball contact

title: Hit From the Inside (Two Ball) Drill

description.name: The Two Ball Drill helps promote an inside to out swing to fix a slice and heel contact

steps.name: Using your 7 iron, set up to the ball as normal, the place another ball about one ball width on the outside
Address the ball nearest to you (the inside ball). Take a good swing and try to play the inside ball as normal.

If you do this drill correctly, the inside ball should fly nicely and the outside ball should remain in the same position. If the outside ball moved, your club is not returning to the address position

details.name: This drill can be done with any club (if using a driver make sure both balls are on tees)
This drill includes hitting a golf ball, so it is best to be done on the driving range
This drill mainly attacks the issue of a slice

description.name: The Baseball Drill helps solidify spine angle and balance to improve consistency

steps.name: Take your normal set up to the ball, then stand up straight holding the club in front of your chest as if you were about to swing a baseball bat

Swing the club around your body on a horizontal plane (ie keeping the club parallel to the ground). As the club comes back in front of your body to an imaginary impact position, take note of the club face angle. (The club face should be vertial and the toe of the club pointing to the sky)
Try to over-exaggerate the rotation of your hips, shoulders, and hands. This should produce a club face that appears closed and aimed downwards

details.name: This drill can be done with any club
This drill does not include hitting a golf ball, so it can be done wherever you have space to swing (at home)
This drill mainly attacks the issue of ball contact

description.name: The Ball and Tee Drill focuses on hitting down on the ball to improve ball contact

benefits.name: Teaches 'Hitting Down' to get the ball up

steps.name: Place a tee an inch in front of the ball and push it down so only the top of the tee is showing
Grab a 7-iron and make a swing, trying to 'hit down' on the ball so that you hit the golf ball and take the tee out of the ground with the same strike
As you reach the delivery zone, make sure your right palm is facing the ground to ensure proper downward strike

details.name: This drill can be done with any club except driver
This drill includes hitting a golf ball, so it is best to be done on the driving range
This drill mainly attacks the issue of ball contact

description.name: The Finger Gun Drill helps improve hand pressure to fix a hook

steps.name: Grip your club with your left hand like you normally do
Grip your right hand normally with the back three fingers and with the pointer finger and thumb, make a finger gun
Swing with an emphasis of holding the finger gun on your right hand throughout the swing

details.name: This drill can be done with any golf club
This drill can be done with a golf ball at the driving range, or without a golf ball at home
This drill attacks the issue of hooking

description.name: The Headcover Drill helps keep the swing compact to improve ball contact

benefits.name: Teaches proper shoulder and hip rotation

steps.name: Take a small club headcover and place it under your right armpit (left for left-handed)
Set up to the ball as you normally would and swing the club without dropping the headcover

details.name: This drill can be done with any club
This drill can be done with a golf ball on the range or without a golf ball at home
This drill mainly attacks the issue of ball contact

description.name: The L Drill improves arm and wrist hinge to improve consistency in ball contact

benefits.name: Teaches proper hinge in backswing and follow through

steps.name: Set up for a normal golf swing and take the backswing, stopping when your right arm (left arm for left-handed) is parallel to the ground and your club direction is perpendicular, forming an L
Take your downswing and stop in the same L position at your follow through

details.name: This drill can be done with any club, but is best to be done with an iron or wedge
This drill can be done with a golf ball on the driving range or without a golf ball at home
This drill attacks the issue of ball contact

description.name: The Shoulder Turn Drill improves shoulder rotation and and spine angle to improve ball contact

steps.name: Take your normal golf stance and posture and place the club behind your back anchoring it with your interior elbow
Rotate your shoulders so that each end of the club covers the ball while you maintain proper posture

details.name: This drill should be done using an iron or wedge
This drill does not involve hitting a golf ball, so it can be done at home
This drill mainly attacks the issue of ball contact

description.name: The Wiping Table Drill improves wrist rotation at impact to fix a slice and ball contact

steps.name: Take a stance without a golf club
Swing only with your right hand, and at impact feel like your right hand is wiping a table by covering the area the table would be

details.name: This drill does not use a golf club
This drill can be done at home
This drill mainly attacks the issue of a slice

description.name: The Handshake Drill helps improve wrist rotation at impact to fix a slice

steps.name: Take a stance without a golf club
Take swing with your right hand (left hand if you are left-handed) and in the follow throughwhen you arm is parallel, feel like you are shaking the hand of someone

details.name: This drill does not use a golf club
This drill can be done at home
This drill mainly attacks the issue of a slice
